node.title: Lewis Hamilton hit with grid penalty for Brazil Grand Prix
node.alt: Lewis Hamilton talks into a microphone
node.description: Lewis Hamilton faces an even tougher task to rein in world championship leader Max Verstappen after being hit with a five-place grid penalty for the Brazilian Grand Prix.
node.content:
["Lewis Hamilton clocked the fastest lap at Friday's qualifying\u00a0session for the Brazilian Grand Prix, but will take a five-place grid penalty into Sunday's race after replacing his engine.", "Stewards also opened an investigation into the seven-time world champion for a technical infringement that could see a further penalty.", "Hamilton is set to start Saturday's sprint race on pole and, should he win that, earn\u00a0himself three world championship points and ensure he starts no lower than sixth\u00a0at the historic Interlagos circuit in S\u00e3o Paulo.", "\"That's the first pole in a long time,\" Hamilton said.", "\"A big, big thank you to all the team because they've been working flat out.", "\"It's been so hard coming from the last race for everyone. Going from one race to the other, taking the car apart. Rebuilding it. Just the man hours is insane.", "\"Today was a really good qualifying session. I'm super happy with it.\"", "Hamilton's performance will buoy\u00a0the British driver, but it came at the cost of grid placings and raised more questions about the reliability of the Mercedes power unit.", "It is\u00a0the second time the Mercedes driver has exceeded the limit of three engines for the season, and the penalty will make it even harder to decrease his points\u00a0deficit to Red Bull rival Max Verstappen.", "", "
Lewis Hamilton was over four tenths of a second faster than Max Verstappen.(Getty Images: Buda Mendes)
", "Hamilton was\u00a00.438 seconds ahead of Verstappen in the practice session. He trails the Dutchman in the drivers' championship by 19 points heading into Sunday's race.", "Red Bull's Sergio Perez was more than half a second behind Hamilton. Mercedes driver Valtteri Bottas came fourth.", "The decision by Mercedes to change the internal combustion engine will not affect Hamilton's starting position in Saturday's qualifying sprint race at Interlagos.", "However, it means the British driver will not start higher than sixth in Sunday's race, even if he wins the qualifying sprint.\u00a0", "Hamilton took a 10-place grid penalty for a new engine in Turkey. Bottas has faced similar problems, which has raised questions about the engine's reliability.", "The Brazilian GP will be the third event of the season with a qualifying sprint race on Saturday to determine Sunday's grid.", "The two previous sprint races were held in Silverstone and Monza.", "Friday's practice is the only chance for the teams to change their set-up before the evening's qualifying.", "ABC/AP"]
